item.title: Allen Ginsberg
item.description: Beat Generation Poet Counterculture Openly gay Known for raw - grotesque - unrefined - gritty poetry meant to be heard, not read

item.title: Mark Twain
item.description: Mark Twain ![[images/Pasted image 20230410035635.png|100]] born Samuel Langhorne Clemens writer - satirist - one of the greatest American writers and the father of American literature

item.title: Symbols, Motifs, and Themes
item.description: Symbols, motifs, and themes are often confused with each other. Though they share similarities, they are vastly different. Themes are abstract ideas Motifs are more concrete and appear in the text multiple times Symbols are also more concrete, but unlike motifs, they do not reappear.

item.title: Character of Dogs
item.description: Character of Dogs By [[Robert Louis Stevenson]] Full Text THE CHARACTER OF DOGS The civilisation, the manners, and the morals 1 of dog-kind are to a great extent subordinated to those of his ancestral master, man.

item.title: Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: Quotes â€œThe difficulty of literature is not to write, but to write what you mean; not to affect your reader, but to affect him precisely as you wish.

item.title: Theater of Absurd
item.description: Anti-Language No fixed pattern Characters talk disorderly What the character has said is not the words that his partner has asked or wanted to get.

item.title: A Room of One's Own by Virginia Woolf
A Portrait of The Artist as a Young Man
item.description: This is a movie based on the novel. A pale, boring 90 minute distillation of 299 pages. Something a 10 minute summary does a better job of.

item.title: America by Allen Ginsberg
Dawn At Puri by Jayanta Mahapatra
item.description: author: Jayanta Mahapatra Place: Puri, Orissa called “Gate of Heaven” dying there = auspicious talks about rites and rituals we don’t question, faith widows and what they faced

item.title: George Bernard Shaw
item.description: Playwright Born in Dublin Grew up in poverty Dad was alcoholic

item.title: Imagine by John Lennon
item.description: by [[John Lennon]] no countries, no religion, no possessions, no division no hunger anti-war pacifist John Lennon asks us to imagine a world, a dream world where humanity is free of conflicts and barriers.

item.title: Nagamandala
item.description: [[Story Theatre]] Story within a story based on the two stories Karnad heard from his mentor, Prof Ramanujan based on folklore

item.title: Partition by W.H Auden
item.description: by W.H. Auden About the Author Summary and themes about the India - Pakistan partition in 1947 angry about partition, directed towards Radcliffe

item.title: Preludes
item.description: [!NOTE]- Poem The winter evening settes down With smell of steaks in passagewats Six o’clock The burnt-out ends of smoky days.

item.title: Pygmalion
item.description: Pygmalion Play Written by [[George Bernard Shaw]] in 1912 ![[inbox/unprocessed/Victorian Era]] Title is based on Greek mythology Pygamlion - a sculptor; makes an ivory statue representing ideal womanhood; falls in love w his own creation, names her Galatea; prays and gets the statue brought to life

item.title: Sailing to Byzantium by WB Yeats
item.description: by ![[WB Yeats]] written in 1926 Yeats was in his 60s “the state of my soul and some of my thoughts about the subject” time of industrial revolution

item.title: Schindler's List
item.description: Director - Steven Spielberg Year - 1993 Plot Story of [[Oskar Schindler]] - how he redeems himself - German patriot and Nazi supporter to someone who uses his operations and business to save as many Jews as possible

item.title: Sem IV English Syllabus
item.description: Module 1: The Essay [[A Room of Ones Own|Room of One’s Own]] - [[Virginia Woolf]] [[The Character of Dogs]] by [[Robert Louis Stevenson]] [[Advice to Youth]]- [[Mark Twain]] Module 2 : The Poetry [[Partition by WH Auden]] [[Sailing to Byzantium]] by [[WB Yeats]] [[Preludes]] by [[TS Eliot]] [[Dawn At Puri]] by [[Jayanta Mahapatra]] [[America - Allen Ginsberg]] by [[Allen Ginsberg]] [[Imagine - John Lennon]] by John Lennon Module 3 : The Novel & Drama The Moon and Six Pence- William Somerset Maugham [[The Moon and Six Pence]] [[A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man]] - James Joyce [[Nagamandala]] - Girish Karnad Module 4 Visual Texts [[Schindler’s List]] [[Pygmalion]] by [[George Bernard Shaw]]

item.title: Story Theatre
item.description: A type of theatre in which the performer tells a story using a combination of acting, mime, music, dance adapted from traditional folktale

item.title: Stream of Consciousness
item.description: important author - [[Virginia Woolf]] - Mrs Dalloway 2 Orlando

item.title: T.S. Eliot
item.description: Prominent author Wrote The Waste Land - known as the Bible of 20th Century one of the most important authors of 20th century Nobel laureate Modernism Wrote [[Preludes]]

item.title: Virginia Woolf
item.description: ![[images/woolf.jpg|100]] Feminist Modernist writer pioneer in use of [[Stream of Consciousness]] as a narrative device Part of Bloomsbury Group husband Leonard Woolf | started Hogarth Press w Leonard Woolf Most famous works - novels - Mrs Dalloway and To the Lighthouse

item.title: WB Yeats
item.description: Irish poet - Irish Nationalist Symbolist Inspired by Pre-Raphaelites and William Blake poetry was a reaction to the naturalistic and realistic poetry of the Victorian age
